data.title: Add a cosmetic empty line after the config_version=3 hint in project.godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, master branch.

**Issue description:**
Godot now saves `config_version=3` as a (non mandatory) compatibility hint in project.godot, it looks like this:
```
config_version=3
[application]

config/name="Platformer"
config/icon="res://icon.png"
run/main_scene="res://stage.tscn"
```

It would look much cleaner like this:
```
config_version=3

[application]

config/name="Platformer"
config/icon="res://icon.png"
run/main_scene="res://stage.tscn"
```

;)

data.title: GDNative register_property
Impossible to use signals defined in gdscripts which extend other gdscripts
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Arch Linux; Godot v3.0-alpha (custom built)

**Issue description:**
I created an `entity.gd` script with utility functions like `grid_move`. This script is extended by two other scripts, `player.gd` and `projectile.gd`.
`player.gd` defines two signals:
```
signal hit(prev_health, current_health)
signal spawned(health, move_timeout_timer)
```
These signals don't appear in the connections menu, and I can't connect them manually using `connect`. They appear in `get_signal_list`.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a base script
2. Create a script with a signal that extends the previous script and attach it to a node
3. Try to connect this signal to any other node

data.title: Text editor lagging on script heavy projects
data.body:
![example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11078863/28532059-54ad13f4-70a1-11e7-9e8e-b6c4b15f5e49.png)
OS: Win7
PC specs: 4-core i5, 32Gb RAM
Godot version - 2.1.3 stable


On a script heavy project with a large scripts and many cross-references text editor starting to lag formidably on every syntax check/code competition. Increasing delays helps to type text but does not fix lags at all. Performance check shows a large spikes of CPU time consumption during text entry - up to 100% of one core usage. This really makes editor extremely uncomfortable to use in a large projects.

I still can't construct refined example project to show it seems(I'll try some more, it took, three months of coding to make my real project to lag this much).
My working project(that I still too embarrassed to show, sorry) have a heavy game logic and have 620 lines of code in the most lagging script, arount 40 functions in it, 7 imported scenes with heavy scripts and 8 scenes loaded from script also with scripts, and on top of that 4 autoload singleton scripts.

data.title: Add macOS main menu (2.1)
data.body:
## Commit 1:
- Add macOS main menu.
- Fixes #8055 (menu) & #9705 (default hide/show shortcuts)

## Commit 2:
- Fix {is,set}_window_fullscreen to detect if window actually is in full-screen mode (can be toggled using green zoom button).
- Fix {get,set}_current_screen and set_window_maximized to act in the same way as on Windows/X11 (Move window to selected screen/maximize on current screen).

data.title: Image.blit_rect_mask add optional use_alpha
data.body:
I need to draw with an transparent color this is currently not possible so I added this with default value false

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/image.cpp#L1687

```
void Image::blit_rect_mask(const Ref<Image> &p_src, const Ref<Image> &p_mask, const Rect2 &p_src_rect, const Point2 &p_dest, bool use_alpha) {

...

if ( (!use_alpha && msk->get_pixel(src_x, src_y).a != 0) || (use_alpha && msk->get_pixel(src_x, src_y).a == 0)) {
```

---

Another thing, calculating `src_y` on the inner for looks like it could be done only once in the outer for(line 1681) or am I seeing something wrong?

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/image.cpp#L1685


Master branch

data.title: "Compile Error: Identifier not found" when using AutoLoad singletons in tool scripts
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** v3.0-alpha


**Issue description:**
Using an AutoLoad singleton in a `tool` script causes a Compile Error when the script is ran in the editor:
```
 res://objects/random_tile_map/random_tile_map.gd:22 - Compile Error: Identifier not found: Logger
```
Expected behavior: load singletons in `tool` mode, or at least pre-set them to something like `null` so that you can test with `get_tree().is_editor_hint()` and call functions on them only when available.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add an AutoLoad singleton called `Test` with a single function `test()`
2. Add a node with this script:
```
tool
extends Node

func _ready():
  if !get_tree().is_editor_hint(): Test.test()
```
3. Save, or reload the project if needed

data.title: [NativeScript] fix double free but on exit
Fix switching SRGB extension happen before binding of texture
data.body: Previously, texture parameter `_TEXTURE_SRGB_DECODE_EXT` was changed before the call of `glBindTexture`, which caused modification of previously bound texture instead of desired one. Now it's changed after `glBindTexture`.

data.title: EditorNode: fix missing distraction-free tooltip
pass string as parameter? C ++ module
data.body:
If I can not have "const char *" parameters in the functions, how would I do if I need to pass a string as a parameter?

Example:

#In my.h

`myFunction(const char *s, int i=0);`

#In my.cpp

```
MyClass::myFunction(const char *s, int i)
{
//Here you would use the parameters
}
```

#Calling myFunction with gd script:

`myFunction("I exist?", 2)
`

data.title: [Suggestion] - Alpha transparency for cells?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3 stable

**Issue description:**
After looking at the fog of war demo, it's nice. However, that got me thinking of `set_cell`

`void set_cell( int x, int y, int tile, bool flip_x=false, bool flip_y=false, bool transpose=false )`

maybe, add an optional parameter for alpha transparency? (0.00 to 1)

This way, you could create smooth fading out effects with fog (or whatever tile you choose). Or would this be too big of a performance issue?

data.title: [GDNative] new GDNative API
data.body:
This adds GDNative as a separate class type.
It can be used to interface with native libraries by
using "native calls", which can be registered by modules
(and in future other GDNative libraries?).

It also reworks the currently called "GDNativeScript" into a
"NativeScript" that just makes use of the new GDNative instead
of it being the component that implements that functionality.

data.title: UWP: Fix build issue caused by atomic operations
data.body: UWP does not support `InterlockedExchangeSubtract64`.

data.title: Dynamic exported NodePath
data.body:
Example:
Create hierarchy -
Node A
-Node B
--Node C
Add script to Node A with export(NodePath) var node_c
Assign Node C to the exported node_c var
Reparent Node C so that Node A is the new parent
Current behavior: exported Node Path stays "Node B/Node C"
Suggested behavior: exported NodePath updates to become "Node C"

data.title: Object#has_user_signal with signal keyword
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux - 3.0 [25678b187]

**Issue description:**
Using `Object#has_user_signal` does not work for signals using the `signal` keyword.  It requires them to be explicitly added via `Object#add_user_signal`.

**Steps to reproduce:**

For example this prints `false`:

```gdscript
signal foo
func _ready():
	print(self.has_user_signal("foo"))
```

while this prints `true`:

```gdscript
signal foo
func _ready():
	self.add_user_signal("foo")
	print(self.has_user_signal("foo"))
```

Of course the `signal foo` line is unnecessary in the second case, but this is the new syntax as I understand it.

data.title: Tabs tab_changed signal add old_tab
data.body:

would be nice to have something like this

`ADD_SIGNAL(MethodInfo("tab_changed", PropertyInfo(Variant::INT, "old_tab"), PropertyInfo(Variant::INT, "new_tab")));`

The signal is used in 
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/editor/editor_node.cpp
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/editor/editor_node.h

data.title: [2.1] Updated OS X audio driver with improvements from 3.0
Fix Right-Click (Ctrl-Click) on OS X
data.body: Same fix that I've submitted for 2.1 but updated for 3.0.

data.title: Suppress get_edited_scene_root error
data.body:
Suppress this error on editor launch:
`ERROR: get_edited_scene_root: Index current_edited_scene out of size (edited_scene.size()).`

Error occurs due to ImportDock's PropertyEditor calling `edit` then `update_tree` before EditorData current_edited_scene changes from -1, resulting in index out of range.

data.title: [3.x] Silent failure on attempting to import non-valid audio files.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux (Ubuntu 17.04) 64-bit. Godot master pull version 38c417b.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Attempting to import a non-valid audio file does not generate any errors or warnings when running a program. It does generate errors/warnings on the command line when initially attempting to import.

It also appears to crash Godot on trying to exit the project and/or program. Reloading the project afterwards appears to have the stream on the AudioStreamPlayer object set to null.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a non-valid audio file, add it to a project structure, set up an AudioStreamPlayer with the stream set to said file and set it playing/autoplay.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Audio_Import_Issues.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1168102/Audio_Import_Issues.zip)

data.title: Add .to_local/.to_global methods on Node2D and Spatial
data.body:
Those are just helpers around `get_global_transform().affine_inverse().xform()` and `get_global_transform().xform()`.
Closes #6087

data.title: EditorNode: request_attn when behind other windows
data.body: The current version requests attention only when minimized, which might not work as expected when it's not minimized but doesn't have focus.
